knimeNode.name: Dictionary Tagger
knimeNode.shortDescription: Assigns specified tags values of specified tag types to terms specified in a dictionary column.

fullDescription.intro: This node recognizes named entities specified in a dictionary column and assigns a specified tag value and type. Optionally the recognized named entity terms can be set unmodifiable, meaning that the terms are not modified or filtered afterwards by any following node.

tab.name: General options
tab.option: The column containing the documents to tag.
If checked, the documents of the selected document column will be replaced by the new tagged documents. Otherwise the tagged documents will be appended as new column.
The name of the new appended column, containing the tagged documents.
Select the tokenizer used for word tokenization. Go to Preferences -> KNIME -> Textprocessing to read the description for each tokenizer.

option.name: Number of maximal parallel tagging processes

tab.option: Defines the maximal number of parallel threads that are used for tagging. Please note, that for each thread a tagging model will be loaded into memory. If this value is set to a number greater than 1, make sure that enough heap space is available, in order to be able to load the models. If you are not sure how much heap is available for KNIME, leave the number to 1.

tab.name: Tagger options
tab.option: Specifies the dictionary column containing the terms to search for.
Sets recognized named entity terms unmodifiable.
If checked, case sensitive named entity recognition will be applied, otherwise not.
If checked, terms are tagged as as named entities only if they match exactly with an entity to find. Otherwise terms are tagged if they contain the entity string.
Specifies the tag type of which tag values can be chosen.
Specifies the tag value to use for tagging recognized named entities.

ports.inPort: The input table containing the documents to tag.
The input table containing the dictionary column.
ports.outPort: An output table containing the tagged documents.
